verses.verse: Then Bildad the Shuhite responded:
“When will you cease this torrent of words? Once you start to think rationally, then we can have a sensible discussion.
Why do you treat us like animals and regard us as ignorant?
In your anger you tear yourself to pieces, but the earth will not be forsaken on your account, nor will a single rock be moved from its place.
“The light of the wicked is extinguished, and the flame of his fire no longer shines.
The light in his tent begins to fade and the lamp above him is put out.
His vigorous stride begins to falter and his own plans fail miserably.
He rushes headlong into a net, and his feet are ensnared.
“A trap seizes him by the heel, leaving him unable to escape.
A noose lies hidden on the ground for him; pitfalls lie across his path.
Terrors alarm him on every side, hounding his every step.
His strength is weakened by hunger, and disaster awaits him on all sides.
“His skin is eaten away by disease; the firstborn of death devours his limbs.[b]
He is dragged from the security of his tent and carted off to the king of terrors.[c]
Anyone can live in his tent since it is no longer his; brimstone[d] is scattered over his dwelling.
His roots dry up below, and his branches wither above.
“All memory of him vanishes from the earth; his name is quickly forgotten.
He is thrust from light into darkness and banished from the world.
He leaves no offspring or posterity among his people; there is no survivor where he once lived.
Inhabitants of the west are appalled at his fate, while those of the east are struck with horror.
Such indeed is the dwelling of the impious; such is the home of everyone who cares nothing for God.”
